Likewise when a person has known a loved one for a long time, they develop a deeper [[attachment]] to their partner. According to current scientific understanding of love, this transition from attraction to attachment phase usually happens in about 30 months. After that passion fades, changing love from Consummate to Companionate, or from Romantic love to Liking.
 
Likewise when a person has known a loved one for a long time, they develop a deeper [[attachment]] to their partner. According to current scientific understanding of love, this transition from attraction to attachment phase usually happens in about 30 months. After that passion fades, changing love from Consummate to Companionate, or from Romantic love to Liking.
  +   +
But what happens to couples who separated, then many years later reunited with their lost lovers? This phenomenon is growing as the Internet makes it easy to locate people. Interestingly, the phases of love do not hold. Men and women who reunite with lost loves report that they maintain high levels of lust and attraction throughout their reunited years and also have a strong companionate bond to their partners, as reported by the survey research of Nancy Kalish, Ph.D.
